function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of diagnosis related groups charges and outpatient charges for unit cost estimates may not accurately capture the full cost of treatment.","Impact":"Inaccurate cost estimates may lead to misallocation of resources and healthcare budgeting.","Mitigation":"Conduct a sensitivity analysis using alternative cost estimation methods and consult healthcare economists for validation.","Technologies":"Healthcare cost estimation software, data analytics tools for sensitivity analysis.","People":"Healthcare administrators, policymakers, budget planners.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, government health departments."},{"Description":"Reliance on market price for prescription medicines may not reflect the actual cost incurred by the healthcare system.","Impact":"Misleading cost estimates may result in improper budgeting and resource allocation for pharmaceuticals.","Mitigation":"Leverage data from pharmaceutical procurement records and negotiate pricing agreements with suppliers.","Technologies":"Healthcare procurement software, data analytics for pharmaceutical cost analysis.","People":"Pharmacists, healthcare procurement officers, policymakers.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, government health departments."},{"Description":"Analysis of sickness benefit transfers may not fully represent the economic impact of long-term sickness absence.","Impact":"Failure to capture the true cost of sickness benefit transfers may lead to underestimation of healthcare costs and economic burden.","Mitigation":"Incorporate indirect costs of sickness absence (e.g., productivity loss) into the analysis and validate data with labor market experts.","Technologies":"Economic modeling software, data analytics for indirect cost estimation.","People":"Labor market experts, economists, policymakers.","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, government labor departments."}]}
